ACT
60
Determination of the executor of the will
The testator may designate one or more persons as executors of the will.
The executor of a will can be any person capable of doing business, including a legal entity.
The person designated as the executor of the will is not obliged to accept this duty.
It is considered that the person designated by the testator in the will has accepted the duty of executor of the testator's will, if immediately after the promulgation of the will at which he was present, he did not expressly declare before the court that he does not accept this duty.
It is considered that the person whom the testator designated for that purpose in the will, and who was not present at the promulgation of the will, did not accept the duty of executor of the testator's will, if he did not inform the court that he had been appointed as the executor of the testator's will, within the time limit set by him determined by the court, declared without delay that she accepts this duty.
